Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Level 1
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: College Reading & Writing Skills
Description: Description: This course focuses on the reading, writing and critical thinking skills needed for academic and workplace success. Students will analyse, summarize, and discuss a variety of readings and apply the steps of planning, writing, and revising in response to written prompts. This course prepares students for post-secondary writing tasks, research, and documentation. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Computer Applications
Description: Description: This course will introduce students to the use of word processing and spreadsheet software, as well as, operating systems and the Web to produce technical documents.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Conestoga 101
Description: Description: This self-directed course focuses on introducing new students to the supports, services, and opportunities available at Conestoga College. By the end of this course, students will understand the academic expectations of the Conestoga learning environment, as well as the supports available to ensure their academic success. Students will also be able to identify on-campus services that support their health and wellness, and explore ways to get actively involved in the Conestoga community through co-curricular learning opportunities.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Applied Mathematics
Description: Description: This course is an applied mathematics course enabling the student to utilize arithmetic, algebra, trigonometry and geometry to solve technically oriented problems. This course is designed to develop a proficiency in mathematics necessary for subsequent courses in the Motive Power trades. The course covers both vocational (job oriented) and generic skills (written, analytical and problem-solving).Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Drawings, Schematics and Basic Electricity
Description: Description: This course will introduce the student to basic electrical theory, electrical laws, test equipment, and schematic diagrams and symbols.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Trade and Repair Practices
Description: Description: In this course, students will cover fastening devices, bearings, seals and sealants and the use of precision measuring tools Hours: 14Credits: 1Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Introduction to Truck and Coach Service and Repair
Description: Description: In this course the student is given an overview of truck and coach systems, including the operation and interpretation of precision measuring tools and meters.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Welding for Motive Power
Description: Description: The students will learn the fundamentals of the Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW) and Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) processes as well as oxy-fuel welding and cutting. Topics will include safe operating principles, applications, equipment setup and troubleshooting. Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Level 2
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Career Launch
Description: Description: This course prepares students to conduct an effective job search. Students will explore labour market trends to uncover the hidden job market.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Motive Power Business I
Description: Description: This course will introduce students to the foundations of business both in Canada and globally. Students will study various business structures as well as topics in economics, accounting, marketing, finance and operations management. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Legal Issues in Motive Power
Description: Description: This course will review the legal issues in the motive power trades that cover subjects pertaining to Environmental issues, Liens Act, Vehicle Safety Inspection and sign-off , liabilities and Health and Safety Legislation issues (OHSA).Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Fluid Power Systems
Description: Description: This course covers the fundamentals of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of electrical system circuits and components, light and heavy duty lead acid batteries, gasoline fuel systems, intake and exhaust systems and emission control systems. Another component of this course covers the design, layout and interpretation of electrical system wiring diagrams.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Engine and Fuel Systems I
Description: Description: In this course, students will demonstrate a basic knowledge of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of diesel combustion engine assemblies, cylinder heads and valve trains, lubrication systems, cooling systems, intake and exhaust systems. Additionally, they will examine the fundamental properties, composition and operation of fuel systems – specifically diesel fuel systems, enabling students to perform inspection, maintenance and testing procedures on diesel fuel systems, and recommend appropriate reconditioning or repairs.Hours: 70Credits: 5Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Electrical Systems I
Description: Description: Demonstrate a basic working knowledge of the principles of electrical theory and laws, and use of electrical test equipment. Demonstrate an ability to trace, test and repair electrical circuits and components. Demonstrate a basic knowledge of electromagnetic devices and test and service batteriesHours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Drive Train and Brake Systems I
Description: Description: This course covers the basics of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of power train clutch assemblies, gearing fundamentals, countershaft manual transmissions, driveshafts, power take-off systems (PTO's) and single drive axle assemblies. In addition, students will demonstrate a basic working knowledge of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of hydraulic brake and air brake systems.Hours: 84Credits: 6Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Level 3
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Motive Power Business II
Description: Description: This course provides the student with an introduction to the requirements of operating a small business. Introduces the entrepreneurial concepts of business management including feasibility assessment, raising capital, business planning, marketing products and services and managing employees. The course covers principles needed to operate a business. Students will develop a formal and thorough business plan. Students will utilize prior and concurrent learning in areas of marketing, accounting, finance and operations.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: MOTV2205CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Motive Power Shop Management
Description: Description: In this course the student will study proper shop documentation, repair orders, service reports, warranty claims and equipment maintenance responsibilities. This can include pay structures, customer retention, waste management and recall notices. Shop organization and reporting structure of different types of businesses will also be studied.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Trade Practices and Drive Train Systems II
Description: Description: This course covers information accessing and shop communications as well as the basics of cabs and control systems, tractor-trailer and articulating coach configurations. In addition, students will demonstrate a working knowledge of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of clutch and flywheel assemblies, multiple countershaft manual transmissions and auxiliary sections, multiple speed and double reduction drive axle assemblies, power divider tandem drive assemblies and electronically controlled standard transmissions.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Engine Systems II
Description: Description: In this course, the student will demonstrate a working knowledge of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of air brake systems, hydraulic and air-over-hydraulic brakes, tire and wheel assemblies, wheel end assemblies, mechanical suspension systems, and air suspension systems.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Steering, Suspension and Brake Systems
Description: Description: In this course, the student will demonstrate a working knowledge of the construction, operating principles, testing and servicing of air brake systems, hydraulic and air-over-hydraulic brakes, tire and wheel assemblies, wheel end assemblies, mechanical suspension systems, and air suspension systems.Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Vehicle Electrical/Electronic Management and Emission Systems
Description: Description: In this course, the student will demonstrate a working knowledge of electronic service tools, vehicle computer fundamentals and electronic input circuit components. Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Name: Level 4
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Engine Failure Analysis
Description: Description: This course will examine the causes of engine failure. The student will demonstrate analytical skills to determine the reasons for engine failure by examining wear factors, oil analysis and macroscopic/microscopic examination and failed components.Hours: 42Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Electrical Diagnostics and Repair
Description: Description: In this course, the student will demonstrate a working knowledge of the purpose, construction and repair of electrical circuit schematic diagrams, heavy duty cranking systems, heavy duty auxiliary systems and electronic fundamentals. Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Electric Hybrids
Description: Description: The main focus of this course is to introduce students to different types of hybrids including current and future designs.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Parts Management
Description: Description: In this course, students will examine point of purchase including VIN decoding and parts lookup, inventory control procedures, billing and account setups, parts delivery, core and return processes, independent and dealership models including trade and retail accounts, and job shadowing in a parts environment. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Fuels and Diagnostics
Description: Description: In this course, students will observe and analyse driveability issues relating to fuels, sensor readings, fault codes and exhaust emission analysis. Students will also become familiar with scan tool operation including datastreams and parameters, output controls, data recording, an introduction to multiplexing and CAN BUS. Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Program: Motive Power Technician - Truck and Coach
Name: Fuel Systems II
Description: Description: In this course, students will demonstrate a basic knowledge of diesel fuel injection helix metering, electronic unit Injector (EUI) systems, engine governors, gasoline and alternate fuel injection systems.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:
